<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Ringhorn Ram](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1273)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Ringhorn rams, named for the massive, curving spirals protruding from their heads, travel the plains. Though these rams tend to be slightly more playful and less vindictive than those in the mountains, they are no less stubborn or hardy.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 14

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 12

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 9
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Ram_Rosethorn.png" />
</column>

</row>

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
hoof +7,
**Damage** 1d6+3 bludgeoning

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
horn +7 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)),
**Damage** 1d4+3 piercing

**Nimble Stride**   Rams ignore difficult terrain caused by narrow ledges.

**Ram Charge** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The ram Strides twice in a straight line and then makes a horn Strike with a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.
